wikipedia_page.main: Robert Martin (c. 1853 – 9 March 1917) was a Scottish golfer from St Andrews. He was runner-up in The Open Championship at Prestwick in 1875 and he won the Open at St Andrews in 1876 and 1885.

|1876 ||  Bob Martin 1st||86||90||–||–||176||  Due to a controversial ruling, Bob Martin finished in a tie for first.  In protest, his opponent Davie Strath refused to participate so Martin walked the course and became the Open Champion. He won £10.
